answers.author: Richard Downey
answers.text:
Paul-
We have a mixed bag here for phone stipends.  Those that do have them witht he City only get $40, and that is not for SMART phone service, just regular service.  I would advise a stipend over a city ownership as it then prevents people from breaking their city phone, or using it to get receipes and someone getting upset about it.

answers.author: Kirk Bednar
answers.text:
We have two rates $40 and $60 per month.  The higher rate is for employees who by the nature of their job are expected to receive a higher volume of city related business calls (i.e. inspectors, right of way negotiators, etc.)  We consider it an allowance and it is paid through payroll and subject to all applicable taxes.  This is intended to compensate for voice servicesonly, not data services.  We have a government account with Verizon for other wireless services, so any employee who chooses Verizon for their personal wireless services receives a 19% discount.

author: Paul Czohara
text:
Greetings!
Like most organizations, the City of Mesa, Arizona is evaluting stipends for employee-owned cell phones and SMART phones used for City business - in lieu of City-owned devices.  If you compensate your employees for the use of their wireless devices, please reply with the amounts and how the amount is determined (e.g., voice only, voice/data, etc).  If you offer a device purchase allowance, please provide that amount also.
Thank you!
Paul Czohara
IT Administration
City of Mesa, Arizona
title: What is your cell phone stipend amount?
